properties.areaDesc: Mono; Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake; Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties; Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area; Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Northern Washoe County; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Surprise Valley California; Greater Lake Tahoe Area
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 1 at 11:50AM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
* On Sunday a sharp cold front will rapidly push through the
region, bringing strong winds and a quick burst of snow.
Widespread southwest winds Sunday morning will shift to the
northwest behind the front. This will bring travel impacts on
roadways and rough air for aviation. The strongest winds are
anticipated to be near and south of US-50, with US-395 and US-95
possibly seeing travel restrictions for high profile vehicles.
Areas of blowing dust are also possible near and east of US-95.
A very dry air mass will be in place ahead of the cold front,
which along with the strong winds will bring increased fire
danger for Mono and Mineral Counties.

* A brief period of higher intensity snow is also likely during
the day Sunday, which may cause travel impacts on roadways
including across Sierra passes. Road impacts in Western Nevada
cities remain more uncertain due to warm ground temperatures.
However, don't be surprised if there are slick roads coming home
from Sunday afternoon gatherings. Icy spots on roadways could
linger into Monday morning.

* Monday and Tuesday will be cold, certainly compared to what
we've seen recently. Temperatures Monday will be about 30
degrees colder compared to Saturday. Brisk north winds will
bring wind chills in the teens and 20s in warmer valley
locations with well below zero reading in the higher elevations
of the Sierra. Snow showers are possible in this cold airmass,
including lake effect snow squalls south of Pyramid, Tahoe, and
Walker Lakes. This could affect travel on I-80 between Reno and
Fernley during the Monday morning commute.
